2026-01-08.body:
CARE Ratings downgraded Mukka Proteins due to a 226-day working capital cycle and higher inventory buildup.

Outlook changed to Negative citing liquidity pressure, debt coverage issues, and forex risks.

Source: ScoutQuest

2026-01-08.title: adani ports mundra handles india's 1st fully laden vlcc, boosts energy security
2026-01-08.body:
Adani Ports' Mundra Port berths India's first fully laden Very Large Crude Carrier (VLCC), Mt New Renown, showcasing advanced logistics.

Mundra's VLCC jetty, linked to HPCL Rajasthan Refinery, boosts India's energy security, efficiency, and regional economic growth.

Source: NDTV Profit

2026-01-08.title: stocks to watch: bharat forge, vedanta, bajaj finserv amid key updates
2026-01-08.body:
Stocks to watch: Bharat Forge, Vedanta, RVNL, BHEL, Bajaj Finserv; key updates include order wins, results, stake sales.

Bajaj Finserv ups stake in insurance units; Bharat Forge partners Agile Robots for AI automation; Vedanta files court petition.

Source: CNBC TV 18

2026-01-08.title: bhel bags ₹5,400 cr order for odisha ammonium nitrate project
2026-01-08.body:
BHEL secures a domestic order worth approx. INR 5400 Cr from BCGCL, a JV of BHEL and CIL.

Order involves design, engineering, equipment supply, and O&M for a 2000 TPD ammonium nitrate project in Odisha.

Source: BSE

2026-01-08.title: imec services' promoter reclassification rejected by exchange
2026-01-08.body:
IMEC Services' application for reclassification of promoters to public was rejected by the stock exchange.

The company awaits formal communication on the rejection and remains committed to regulatory compliance.

Source: BSE

2026-01-08.body:
Swadha Nature Ltd's Board meeting is scheduled for January 17, 2026, to review Q3 FY26 unaudited results.

The meeting will also address other business matters with Chairman's permission.

Source: BSE

2026-01-08.body:
SBI filed an NCLT case against Future Consumer Ltd citing default from Apr 1, 2022.

Hearing delayed to Jan 8, 2026, with the next date set for Feb 16, 2026.

Source: ScoutQuest

2026-01-08.body:

2026-01-08.body:

Tata Steel faces CCI antitrust allegations for price collusion; plans investments in capacity expansion, sustainable steelmaking, and mining assets.

2026-01-08.body:

2026-01-08.body:
Hindustan Unilever received a Rs 1,560 crore tax demand for FY21-22, citing transfer pricing and depreciation disallowances.

HUL plans to appeal, stating no material impact. Shares fell 0.4% to Rs 2,386.7, flat over 12 months.

Source: NDTV Profit

2026-01-08.title: pragati reviews ₹3.02l cr power projects; pgcil, ntpc lead
2026-01-08.body:
PRAGATI reviewed 43/53 power projects worth Rs 3.02L cr; 10 projects worth Rs 1.1L cr in advanced stages.

PGCIL leads with 20 projects, NTPC with 14; PRAGATI has reviewed 237 projects worth Rs 10.53L cr since 2015.

Source: The Indian Express

2026-01-08.title: ola electric sales plunge 51% in cy25; ather energy overtakes in ev market
2026-01-08.body:
Ola Electric's sales dropped 51.1% in CY25 with 199,318 units sold, compared to 407,700 units in CY24.

Ather Energy overtook Ola Electric as per FADA's annual sales data for electric two-wheelers.

Source: NDTV

2026-01-08.title: hdfc bank retail holding hits 20-qtr low at 9.41%
2026-01-08.body:
Retail holding in HDFC Bank fell to 9.41%, lowest in 20 quarters.

Retail investors, owning 7.5% of Indian equities, reduced HDFC Bank exposure.

Source: CNBC TV18

2026-01-08.title: vodafone idea gains 76% in a year; relief and funding offer breather
2026-01-08.body:
Vodafone Idea's turnaround relies on regulatory relief, promoter support, and funding despite heavy debt and intense competition.

The stock rose 76% in one year; recent government relief and promoter funding provide a temporary breather, but challenges remain.

Source: Trade Brains

2026-01-08.title: mutual funds boost stakes in apollo hospitals & aditya birla capital in q3fy26
2026-01-08.body:
Mutual funds raised stakes in Apollo Hospitals and Aditya Birla Capital in Q3FY26, signaling growing institutional confidence.

Aditya Birla Capital's MF holdings increased to 7.68%, while Apollo Hospitals saw a rise to 16.75%, with expanded scheme participation.

Source: Trade Brains

2026-01-08.title: yuranus infra q2 loss widens 150% despite revenue surge
2026-01-08.body:
Yuranus Infrastructure reported a Q2 FY26 net loss of 0.4 crores, worsening from 0.16 crores in Q1.

The 150% QoQ decline occurred despite a dramatic surge in revenue, highlighting operational challenges.

Source: Marketsmojo

2026-01-08.title: hcltech, tcs lead ai buyouts to boost services
2026-01-08.body:
IT firms are accelerating AI acquisitions to enhance capabilities, with HCLTech acquiring Jaspersoft and Wobby for $240M.

TCS acquired ListEngage for AI-driven customer experiences, while Coforge targets Encora for AI-cloud services.

Source: Financial Express

2026-01-08.body:

data.title: CARE Ratings Upgrades GHCL Textiles; Highlights Improved H1FY26 Performance
data.body:
CARE Ratings upgraded GHCL Textiles' long-term rating to CARE A Stable and short-term to CARE A1.

The upgrade reflects improved operational and financial performance in H1FY26 with full bank repayment.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.title: Solarium Green Energy Reshuffles Top Roles; Rohit Jindal Named CFO
data.body:
Solarium Green Energy's Board approved key changes, including appointing SCS & Co LLP as Secretarial Auditor and Anil Bohra & Associates as Internal Auditor for FY 2025-26.

Himanshu Garg's role changed to President–Growth & International Business, while Rohit Jindal was appointed CFO effective January 9, 2026.

Source: BSE

data.title: Phoenix Mills Q3 Retail Growth Hits 20% YoY; Residential Sales Surge
data.body:
The Phoenix Mills reports 20% YoY retail consumption growth to ₹4,787 cr in Q3 FY26.

Residential sales surged to ₹140 cr, up from ₹58 cr YoY; strong hospitality performance noted.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.title: NTPC to Buy Sinnar Plant for ₹3,800 Cr; Shares Dip 2.3%
data.body:
NTPC to acquire Sinnar Thermal Plant for Rs 3,800 crore, boosting its capacity to 86,987 MW.

NTPC shares fell 2.3% to Rs 336 on NSE; stock is up 5% over the past year.

Source: NDTV Profit

data.title: CRISIL Reaffirms Capri Global Rating; CP Limit Raised to ₹1,500 Cr
data.body:
CRISIL reaffirmed Capri Global Capital's credit rating at Crisil A1.

The Commercial Paper Programme limit was enhanced from Rs. 700 Cr to Rs. 1500 Cr.

Source: BSE

data.title: SocGen Buys 14.33 Lakh Tata Capital Shares at ₹354.50
data.body:
Societe Generale buys 14.33 lakh Tata Capital shares at ₹354.50 each.

data.body:
Bata India completed VRS at its Hosur unit with a financial impact of Rs. 280.6M.

This update follows an earlier intimation on January 8, 2026; no other SEBI disclosures apply.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.title: Akzo Nobel India Names New Chairman & CEO Amid Q3 Profit Surge
data.body:
Akzo Nobel India appoints Shantanu Khosla as independent director and Parth Jindal as chairman, subject to shareholder approval.

Rajiv Rajgopal re-designated as Joint MD & CEO; Akzo Nobel India posted a sharp profit rise in Q3 due to an exceptional gain.

Source: CNBC TV 18

data.title: Toyam Sports H1 FY26: Asset Issues, SEBI Probe Ongoing
data.body:
Toyam Sports' board approved unaudited financials for H1 FY26 with a qualified opinion due to asset impairments.

Over 50% of assets are financial, requiring RBI compliance; SEBI investigation ongoing, shares frozen by ED.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.body:
IREDA's Q3 GNPA is expected at 3.75%, improving from 3.97% QoQ.

NNPA for Q3 is projected to drop to 1.68% from 1.97% QoQ.

Source: Livesquawk

data.body:

Capital Adequacy Ratio revised to 15.52%; 9M profit at 1381.36 cr.

data.body:

data.body:

data.body:

data.body:

No increase in FY26 road capex in the Budget has limited sector pickup.

Source: Business Standard

data.title: Ladam Housing Q4 Results Out; Subsidiaries' Strike-Off May Impact Financials
data.body:
Ladam Affordable Housing approved unaudited results for the Dec 31, 2025 quarter.

Associates Ladam Foods and Lacon India plan strike-off filings, potentially affecting financials.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.title: Akzo Nobel India Board to Review Q3 FY26 Results on Feb 2
data.body:
Akzo Nobel India Ltd to hold board meeting on 2nd Feb 2026 to approve Q3 FY26 unaudited results.

The meeting will review both standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and nine months ending 31st Dec 2025.

Source: BSE

data.title: J&K Bank to Review Q3 Results on Jan 20; Trading Window Reopens Jan 23
data.body:
Jammu & Kashmir Bank will consider unaudited financial results for Q3 and nine months ended Dec 31, 2025, on Jan 20, 2026.

Trading window for designated persons will reopen on Jan 23, 2026, post results declaration.

Source: BSE

data.title: Akzo Nobel India Faces ₹8.82 L GST Demand; Reviews Next Steps
data.body:
Akzo Nobel India receives GST order dated Jan 9, 2026 for Rs 8.82 lakh demand.

Disallowance pertains to Apr 2021-Mar 2022 ITC; company reviewing next steps.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.title: Akzo Nobel India Faces ₹6.73 Cr GST Dispute with WB Dept
data.body:
Akzo Nobel India received a tax dispute order from WB GST Dept for Rs. 67.3M.

The company has responded, reviewing the order; litigation remains ongoing.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.title: Akzo Nobel Names Rajiv Rajgopal CEO to Drive Growth
data.body:
Akzo Nobel appoints Rajiv Rajgopal as Joint MD and CEO to boost leadership.

The move aims to drive growth strategies for Akzo Nobel India Limited.

Source: Livesquawk

data.title: Tejas Networks Signals Strong Growth Ahead with Strategic Plans
data.body:
Tejas Networks announces positive long-term outlook, signaling strong growth potential.

The company highlights strategic plans for upcoming years to drive growth.

Source: Livesquawk

data.title: IREDA Q3 Profit Surges 36% YoY to ₹5.8B
data.body:
IREDA's Q3 net profit rose to 5.8B rupees from 4.25B YOY.

Q3 revenue grew significantly to 21.3B rupees from 16.98B YOY.

Source: Livesquawk

data.title: PNB's NIM Concerns Cloud H2 Outlook
data.body:
PNB's balance sheet grows, but concerns over NIM impact H2 outlook.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.title: Future Lifestyle Holds 29th CoC Meeting Under CIRP
data.body:
Future Lifestyle Fashions Ltd held its 29th CoC meeting under CIRP on Oct 10, 2025.

The company's affairs are managed by Resolution Professional Ravi Sethia, as per NCLT order.

Source: BSE

data.title: Mindspace REIT Allots Units at ₹464.64 to Sundew & Pramaan Shareholders
data.body:
Mindspace Business Parks REIT allotted 83,13,963 units at Rs. 464.64/share to Sundew shareholders.

Additionally, 3,08,45,379 units were allotted at Rs. 464.64/share to Pramaan shareholders.

Source: BSE

data.title: IREDA Q3 Income ₹2139 Cr, PBT ₹717 Cr; Gross NPA at 3.2%
data.body:
Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency reported Q3 income of ₹2139.6 Cr, PBT ₹716.9 Cr.

Gross NPA stood at 3.2%, Net NPA at 0.8%, and CRAR was 15.5% as of Dec 31, 2025.

data.body:

data.body:

data.body:

Source: BSE

data.body:

Subsidiaries will stop operations starting January 9, 2026.

data.title: BCPL Bags ₹86.64M Eastern Railway Electrification Contract
data.body:
BCPL Railway Infrastructure secures Rs. 86.64M contract under Eastern Railway Sealdah Division.

Scope includes 25KV overhead electrification, related works, to be completed in 12 months.

Source: ScoutQuest

data.body:

Source: BSE

data.body:

Source: BSE

data.title: HOMRE Q3: ₹687.8L Revenue, ₹2.04L Profit; Consolidated Loss ₹23.55L
data.body:
HOMRE Ltd (formerly Triton Corp Ltd) approved unaudited financial results for Q3 and nine months ending Dec 31, 2025.

Standalone revenue was Rs. 687.8L with a net profit of Rs. 2.04L; consolidated revenue reached Rs. 687.5L with a loss of Rs. 23.55L.

Source: BSE

data.title: India Inc Q3 Profits to Rise 16%, Says Motilal; Challenges for Exporters, IT & Pharma
data.body:
India Inc may achieve 16% YoY profit growth in Q3, says Motilal Oswal.

Exporters, chemicals, pharma, IT, BFSI, FMCG, EMS may face earnings challenges.

Source: The Economic Times

data.title: Inventurus Cancels Jan 20 Investor Meet Due to Scheduling Issues
data.body:
Inventurus Knowledge Solutions Ltd canceled its Analyst/Investor Meet scheduled for Jan 20, 2026.

The cancellation, announced on Jan 9, 2026, was due to unforeseen scheduling exigencies.

Source: BSE

data.title: Private Banks Lose Share as NBFC Credit Soars 19%
data.body:
Indian banks face challenges as deposit growth slowed to 9.1% by Dec 2025, down from 11% a year ago, while credit growth rose to 11.8%.

Private banks like HDFC Bank and SBI face market share loss to non-banks, with NBFC credit growing 19.1% and market funds up 21.1%.

Source: Moneycontrol

data.title: National Standard Surges After BSE Approves Lodha Merger; No New Updates from Company
data.body:
National Standard (India) Ltd observed unusual price movement post-BSE's merger approval with Lodha Developers on Dec 30, 2025.

The company confirmed no new announcements under SEBI regulations that justify the price behavior.

Source: BSE

data.title: Muthoot Microfin Settles ₹40L PF Penalty, No Major Impact Expected
data.body:
Muthoot Microfin Ltd settled Rs. 40.08L penal damages for delayed PF dues during COVID lockdown.

Company remitted PF contributions in March 2021 and foresees no material financial impact.

Source: BSE

data.title: Texmaco Rail Secures ₹29.6M Order for Bird Prevention System
data.body:
Texmaco Rail wins INR 29.6M order from East Coast Railways for a bird prevention system in KUR Division.

The project, adhering to RDSO guidelines, will be completed within 365 days excluding taxes.

Source: MarketScreener

data.title: Ashok Leyland Opens ₹1,000 Cr E-Bus Plant in Lucknow, Boosts EV Output
data.body:
Ashok Leyland inaugurated its first e-bus plant in Lucknow, UP, with a Rs 1,000 crore investment, boosting EV and alternative fuel vehicle production.

The 70-acre facility, IGBC Platinum-rated, will produce 2,500-5,000 EVs annually and create 3,000 jobs, aligning with UP's industrial growth.

Source: Moneycontrol

data.title: Air Pollution Spurs ₹18,913 Cr Respiratory Drug Market Growth
data.body:
India's worsening air quality boosts respiratory drug sales, with the market valued at Rs 18,913 crore and growing at 8% CAGR.

Anti-asthma and COPD products dominate with 61% market share; Apollo Hospitals highlights pollution as a key trigger for respiratory issues.

Source: News18
